Package au.edu.sydney.hecfor.erp.tgr

Class TGRFacadeImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.sydney.hecfor.erp.tgr.TGRFacadeImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TGRFacade
    public class TGRFacadeImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TGRFacade
    Default implementation of the TGRFacade interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TGRFacadeImpl()
      This is just the default constructor - you may rely on it being present in the module you test.

      Preconditions:
      None
      Postconditions:
      Note that this does NOT inject a product provider, the initial state is with this provider being null.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Product addProduct​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String manufacturer)
      Adds a new product to the system.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      A new Product with the given information will be present in the system.
      int addStorage​(java.lang.Integer storageID, int productID, int count, java.lang.String location)
      Adds a stored amount of the given product

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      An amount of the given product will be stored with the provided details.
      void assignApprovalStatus​(int productID, java.lang.String approvalStatus)
      Sets a Product to an approval status.
      java.util.List<Product> getAllProducts()
      Returns a list of all current products.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None
      int getLastReportedCount​(int storageID)
      Preconditions:
      A storage with the matching id exists in this instance
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
      TGR must be in a logged-in state prior to this call
      Postconditions:
      java.lang.String[] getStorageContacts​(int id)
      Gets the contact details of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None

      Gets the count of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None

      Gets the location of the given storage.

      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStorages()
      Returns a list of all current product storage.

      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:

      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getStorages​(int productID)
      Returns a list of all current storage matching the given product.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      None
      boolean login​(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String password)
      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
      The TGRFacade must not be in a logged-in state prior to this call
      Postconditions:
      If the credentials are valid the TGR will be in a logged in state until its Auth provider is changed or logout() is called.
      void logout()
      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
      TGR must be in a logged-in state prior to this call
      Postconditions:
      TGR will no longer be in a logged-in state
      int makeReport​(int storageID)
      Preconditions:
      A storage with the matching id exists in this instance
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      The TRGFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
      TGR must be in a logged-in state prior to this call
      The TGRFacade must have a corresponding service provider for any channel preference the given storage has set (via setReportPreferences)
      Postconditions:
      A report will be sent for this storage.
      void modifyStorageCount​(int id, int modifier)
      Modifies the count of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      The selected storage count will reflect the modification.
      void setAuthProvider​(AuthModule provider)
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      All method calls requiring this service will be passed to the given provider until this method is invoked again.
      If this method is invoked with a null parameter (a legal operation) all such calls will fail.
      This method will set TGR to a logged-out state regardless of any prior Auth state
      void setEmailProvider​(EmailService provider)
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      All method calls requiring this service will be passed to the given provider until this method is invoked again.
      If this method is invoked with a null parameter (a legal operation) all such calls will fail.
      void setFaxProvider​(FaxService provider)
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      All method calls requiring this service will be passed to the given provider until this method is invoked again.
      If this method is invoked with a null parameter (a legal operation) all such calls will fail.
      void setPrintProvider​(PrintService provider)
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      All method calls requiring this service will be passed to the given provider until this method is invoked again.
      If this method is invoked with a null parameter (a legal operation) all such calls will fail.
      void setProductProvider​(ProductList provider)
      Injects a product module provider to the system

      Preconditions:
      None
      Postconditions:
      The system will call the given provider for all product related operations
      All storages will be cleared, and the null ID state for new storages will be reset.
      void setReportingProvider​(ReportFacade provider)
      Preconditions:

      Postconditions:
      All method calls requiring this service will be passed to the given provider until this method is invoked again.
      If this method is invoked with a null parameter (a legal operation) all such calls will fail.
      void setReportPreferences​(int storageID, boolean email, boolean print, boolean fax)
      Preconditions:
      A storage with the matching id exists in this instance
      At least one preference must be set.
      void setStorageContacts​(int storageID, java.lang.String faxNumber, java.lang.String emailAddress)
      Adds owner contact details for a given storage

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      An report will be sent for all true preference parameter channels for all subsequent reports
      void setStorageCount​(int id, int count)
      Sets the count of the given storage.

      Preconditions:
      The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
      Postconditions:
      The selected storage count will reflect the new value.

      • addProduct

        public Product addProduct​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String manufacturer)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Adds a new product to the system.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        A new Product with the given information will be present in the system.
        Specified by:
        addProduct in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        name - The product name. May not be null or empty.
        manufacturer - The manufacturer. May not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        The Product that has been added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If called with a null Auth provider set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any argument requirements are breached

      • assignApprovalStatus

        public void assignApprovalStatus​(int productID,
                                 java.lang.String approvalStatus)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Sets a Product to an approval status. Can be a step on an approval process or a final outcome.

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        The matching product will be set to the given approval status.
        Specified by:
        assignApprovalStatus in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        productID - The product to assign. Must be positive (may not be zero).
        approvalStatus - The approval status to assign. Must be one of the following: "LAB TESTING", "CLINICAL TRIALS", "APPROVED", "REJECTED".
        If the status is "APPROVED" or "REJECTED" the approval is considered finalised.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) product ID does not match a product that does not have finalised approval in the current product provider. If called with a null Auth provider set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

        Returns a list of all current product represented by "Manufacturer: Name"

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Specified by:
        viewAllProducts in interface TGRFacade
        Returns:
        A list of all current products represented by "Manufacturer: Name". In the case no products can be found, returns an empty list.

      • addStorage

        public int addStorage​(java.lang.Integer storageID,
                      int productID,
                      int count,
                      java.lang.String location)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Adds a stored amount of the given product

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        An amount of the given product will be stored with the provided details.
        Specified by:
        addStorage in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        storageID - The storage ID must be unique, may not be negative, may not be zero. The storage ID may be null, in which case a generated unique ID will be used. This is only available so long as all previous storage IDs have been null - if an ID is provided, all future calls must also provide a unique ID.
        productID - The product to store. Must be positive (may not be zero).
        count - The amount of the product to store. Must be positive (may be zero).
        location - The location of the storage. May not be empty or null.
        Returns:
        The id of the created storage.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) product ID does not match a product in the current product provider. If called with a null Auth provider set. If a null storage ID is given after a non-null storage ID.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

      • setStorageContacts

        public void setStorageContacts​(int storageID,
                               java.lang.String faxNumber,
                               java.lang.String emailAddress)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Adds owner contact details for a given storage

        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        Postconditions:
        An report will be sent for all true preference parameter channels for all subsequent reports
        Specified by:
        setStorageContacts in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        storageID - The storage ID to add details to. Must be positive (may not be zero).
        faxNumber - The owner's fax number. May be null, may not be empty. May only contain digits, spaces, and +().
        emailAddress - The owner's email address. May be null, may not be empty, must contain at least one @ character if not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the given (valid) storage ID does not match an existing storage. If called with a null Auth provider set. If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the argument requirements are breached.

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        None
        Specified by:
        getStorages in interface TGRFacade
        Returns:
        A list of all current storage represented by "ProductID-StorageID: count (location)". In the case no storage can be found, returns an empty list.

                               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Modifies the count of the given storage.

        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:
        The selected storage count will reflect the modification.
        Specified by:
        modifyStorageCount in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        id - The storage id to modify. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        modifier - The modification to be made. May be a positive or negative number. May not reduce the final count below zero.

      • setReportPreferences

        public void setReportPreferences​(int storageID,
                                 boolean email,
                                 boolean print,
                                 boolean fax)
                          throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Preconditions:
        A storage with the matching id exists in this instance
        At least one preference must be set. The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
        TGR must be in a logged-in state prior to this call
        Postconditions:
        A report will be sent for all true preference parameter channels for all subsequent reports
        Specified by:
        setReportPreferences in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        storageID - The target storage id. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        email - Send an email invoice when this storage gets a report
        print - Send a printed invoice when this storage gets a report
        fax - Send an faxed invoice when this storage gets a report
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if TGR is not logged in or the logged in user cannot be authenticated
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter preconditions are breached
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called with a null Auth provider set. If the TGRFacade has a null ProductProvider. If the given (valid) storage ID does not match a known storage.

      • makeReport

        public int makeReport​(int storageID)
               throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Preconditions:
        A storage with the matching id exists in this instance
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of a Product module via TGRFacade.setProductProvider
        The TRGFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
        TGR must be in a logged-in state prior to this call
        The TGRFacade must have a corresponding service provider for any channel preference the given storage has set (via setReportPreferences)
        Postconditions:
        A report will be sent for this storage. Reports will be generated and sent for all set storage preferences through the appropriate services.
        Specified by:
        makeReport in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        storageID - The target storage id. Must be positive, may not be zero.
        Returns:
        The count this storage had at the time of the report
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if TGR is not logged in or the logged in user cannot be authenticated
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter preconditions are breached
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any required provider (Product, Auth, Report, preferred invoice channels) is null. If the given (valid) storage ID does not match a known storage.

        Returns:

        Throws:

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter preconditions are breached

      • login

        public boolean login​(java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
        The TGRFacade must not be in a logged-in state prior to this call
        Postconditions:
        If the credentials are valid the TGR will be in a logged in state until its Auth provider is changed or logout() is called.
        Specified by:
        login in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        userName - The username to verify. May not be null or empty.
        password - The password to verify. May not be null or empty.
        Returns:
        True if the credentials were valid, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter preconditions are breached
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called with a null Auth provider set, or if already in a logged-in state

      • logout

        public void logout()
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Preconditions:
        The TGRFacade must have been injected with a non-null instance of an AuthModule via TGRFacade.setAuthProvider
        TGR must be in a logged-in state prior to this call
        Postconditions:
        TGR will no longer be in a logged-in state
        Specified by:
        logout in interface TGRFacade
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called with a null Auth provider set, or if TGR was not already in a logged-in state

      • setProductProvider

        public void setProductProvider​(ProductList provider)
        Description copied from interface: TGRFacade
        Injects a product module provider to the system

        Preconditions:
        None
        Postconditions:
        The system will call the given provider for all product related operations
        All storages will be cleared, and the null ID state for new storages will be reset.
        Specified by:
        setProductProvider in interface TGRFacade
        Parameters:
        provider - The provider to inject. May be null, however this will result in some product related operations throwing exceptions.

        Specified by:

        public void setReportingProvider​(ReportFacade provider)

        Preconditions:

        Postconditions:
        All method calls requiring this service will be passed to the given provider until this method is invoked again.
        If this method is invoked with a null parameter (a legal operation) all such calls will fail.
